title: Great Chimbu Pig Festival
creator_contributor_role: Papua New Guinea. Dept. of Information and Extension Services, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Papua New Guinea
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Papua New Guinea - Occidental influences
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Papua New Guinea - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Papua New Guinea - Occidental influences
description: Examines in detail the great festival of the Chimbu people of the Central Highlands of New Guinea. The festival is usually performed every five to eight years but Western influences have contributed to the seventeen year gap since the last ceremony. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.
